title: Decompiling DotNet2JScript malware?
content: I've got a .NET malware sample that was transpiled to JScript using DotNet2JScript . The .NET malware assembly was serialized to binary form using BinaryFormatter and then embedded into the JScript source code. How can I transform the serialized malware assembly back to PE-file, so I can analyze it using dnSpy and similar tools? Or is there any tool that can parse metadata from serialized assemblies? Thanks!

comments.text: I used netfleece to decode BinaryFormatter files.
